summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020, forwarded within the US Attorney's Office, regarding the USA v. Maxwell case. A private individual named Mike Jones contacts the prosecution team suggesting that Johan Eliasch, a Swedish businessman living in the UK, may have ties to the case and recommending a search of his aircraft logs for connections.

persons.name: Mike Jones
persons.role: Private individual providing information to prosecutors
persons.context: He emails the US Attorney's Office handling the Ghislaine Maxwell case, suggesting Johan Eliasch may have ties to the underlying acts and recommending a search of his aircraft logs.

persons.name: Johan Eliasch
persons.context: Identified by Mike Jones as a non-US citizen living in the UK who owns three aircraft; Jones suggests searching his aircraft logs might show a connection to the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Mike Jones claims to have been doing work regarding Johan Eliasch for 2-3 years and believes Eliasch may have ties to the acts underlying the Maxwell case.

events.title: Initial email from Mike Jones to prosecutors
events.description: Mike Jones sends an initial email to the US Attorney's Office, introducing himself and suggesting Johan Eliasch may have ties to the Maxwell case.

events.title: Email forwarding within US Attorney's Office
events.description: The email chain is forwarded internally within the US Attorney's Office regarding the USA v. Maxwell case, per their practice.

keyFacts: A private citizen, Mike Jones, contacts the US Attorney's Office prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell to suggest investigating Johan Eliasch, a Swedish businessman living in the UK.
Jones claims Eliasch owns three aircraft and recently changed the tail number of his most-used aircraft (a Falcon 900) to an Aruba registration.
Jones recommends searching the aircraft logs (by tail numbers) as he believes this would show a connection to the underlying acts in the Maxwell case.
The email is forwarded internally within the prosecution team, indicating the tip was received and circulated as part of their investigative practice.
